O2bDAuDa3UE6Eiwn8_FUpA.text: Asian fusion Izakaya style Japanese food is my FAVORITE and Zuma killed it. Third floor of the Cosmopolitan has a lot of restaurant choices, but Zuma is my new favorite. Izakaya is a type of bar/restaurant with small inexpensive (not in the case of Zuma!) plates meant to be eaten with alcohol. Aka Japanese style tapas?  We ordered a lot, here are my favorites ranked highest to lowest :) 1. KUROBUTA PORK BELLY SKEWER: 2 pieces served with yuzu mustard miso. Heavy on the miso with just a slight kick of mustard. Favorite order of the night. Kurobuta is like the wagyu of pork. Fatty, but melt in your mouth kind of fatty, not that never ending chewing kind of fatty.  2. MISO BLACK COD WRAPPED IN HOBA LEAF: In Japan, this dish is called Gindara misozuke. Gindara is a type of cod, closest US relation is the black cod. Buttery, melt in your mouth texture with a miso sauce to eat it with. It's a must order when you go to Izakaya and the portion size was great.  3. SUSHI ROLLS: I can't remember the name, but what we ordered were all great.  4. SOFT SHELL CRAB WITH WASABI SAUCE: A good starter plate. The sauce was what made the plate. If you like wasabi, order it. If not, don't order for just the crab.  5. SHIITAKE WITH GARLIC SOY BUTTER: The flavor was good, but it overpowered the shiitake and the mushy presentation was not my favorite. Shiitake has a lot of flavor on its own and I couldn't appreciate it with how buttery they were.   DON'T ORDER: SHRIMP TEMPURA (boring, did not stand out for any other restaurant) SPICY LAMB WITH MYOGA (served with a gojijan sauce, Japanese don't normally eat lamb... so don't order it at a Japanese restaurant, duh)   Dark, romantic vibe that got a lot louder as the night went on. Music was pretty low so easily able to have a conversation. They have strip view seating, but it's in a party table section so don't expect dinner with a view here.  Strong sake menu and the sommelier can help you out with your choice. The JAPANESE GARIBALDI: V8 on the rocks is what we decided it was. Low alcohol content, tasted more like juicing cleanse than date night drinks.

UYm2RYz_mwEi9noImtTddw.text: After seeing photos of the opening night, I've been meaning to try Zuma. I sat next to the robata grill which was nice because you could watch the shishito peppers, asparagus, mushrooms, etc being grilled. Pretty great experience overall.   The service from my waiter was amazing. I felt like he had good suggestions for the menu and he was so so helpful in helping me choose different dishes. I came by myself, and I wanted to try a few different things without over ordering. He was great at helping me choose some larger portioned dishes with some smaller dishes.   I had the saikyo miso marinated black cod wrapped in hoba leaf, yellowtail sashimi with green chili relish/ponzu/pickled garlic, zuma chirashi maki roll, and chocolate molten cake with ice cream. I highly recommend  the yellowtail sashimi, zuma chirashi maki roll, and the chocolate molten cake. All of them were very flavorful and so beautifully presented. I felt like the black cod's sauce was great but I barely dipped it in the sauce because I felt like it overpowered the cod. That's just my preference, but I probably wouldn't order it if I came for a second time. I think I'd want to try something new.  Overall, the food was good but I probably wouldn't get the black cod because I felt like the sauce was overpowering the cod. The other dishes were great and would definitely recommend those. The restaurant itself is very modern and clean but still very inviting.

HLqXJ-A7tnrgnPyJXwtZlg.text: My wife and I came here on a Friday night expecting to get some good Japanese food, which is our favorite.  We ordered the Premium Omakase menu, which with tax and tip and 2 drinks ran us around $500.    Now for that price, I expect a meal to be absolutely perfect, but there were a few things we found to be poorly executed that brought our experience down a notch.  I think the thing that bothered us the most was the noise level, which is extremely loud dance music.  I know it's Vegas, but it was simply louder than we expected for such a high end meal.  DO NOT come here expecting a quiet romantic meal.    The food was all very good, but not $500 meal level good.  The presentation was spot on, but various itmes were sub par.  The sushi portion, for example, was good but not transcendent like you would expect at this price point.  Food volume and pacing were also an issue.  We were literally served 15 separate dishes.  This made for a very uneven pace to the meal (longer than 2 hours with long gaps between courses) and my wife and I felt like we were going to die from how much we ate.  I wish we had gotten fewer dishes of higher quality.  The service was immaculate and I can't say enough about how nice the staff were.    The decor was great, especially the main bar which is one solid tree trunk, so cool!  All in all, good food but not worth the price imo.

NCnbgRFy_pnOTICq6cZ1qA.text: My friend and I came to Zuma last week for "friends & family week." My friend is vegan and allergic to sesame AND soy. So why would we come to a restaurant known for sushi? Lol. Good question. We were hungry and got invited so why not?   Chef Erick Melendez was up for the challenge! We started off with drinks. Both of us got the Rubabu. It's a little on the tart side, but oh so refreshing! The juice is sweet enough without any added sugar. I also thoroughly enjoyed the foam that sits on the top of the drink throughout its consumption. Even though it's an alcoholic beverage, you can't taste any hint of alcohol. So beware standing up after two of these (as we found out for ourselves).  The vegan/soy-free/sesame-free items that Chef Erick made for us were the Zuma Kappa Maki (ginger, cucumber, & avocado roll), a citrus avocado & tomato salad (not a menu item), Shishito no Suage Wafujio (shishito peppers with wafu salt), slow cooked leeks with shaved truffle (not a menu item), grilled sweet corn, and grilled shitaki mushrooms with garlic chips. Chef Erick really pulled through for us. It was amazing how much attention was put into every detail of making our veggies look and taste amazing!  Since I am not vegan or allergic to anything (that I know of anyways), Erick also made me some extra dishes. These were the Gindara to Ebi no Gyoza (prawn & black cod dumplings), Tomato to Nasu no Wafu Salada (tomato & eggplant salad with ginger & spring onion dressing), and the Maguro no Tataki (sliced seared tuna, chili daikon, & ponzu sauce). I would highly recommend all of these phenomenal dishes.   Last but not least, for dessert we had the fruit platter. This was by far, the most beautiful bowl of exotic fruit I've ever seen, and the taste of this fresh fruit matched it's beauty. Needless to say, my friend and I had a great experience at Zuma and are looking forward to returning soon!

7bq9ZQcUWUy2knvD0DfdMg.text: Crazy good. The pork belly app is delicious. Also loved the jumbo shrimp,  and cod. Nothing but five stars all around

G-ephVqNt6Xi7BZkf-49mg.text: Top-notch! Highly recommended! We ordered the premium omakase and absolutely loved it. One of the most memorable meals we ever had! Comparable to Oriole in Chicago and Bazaar Meat in SLS Hotel here in Vegas. The pork belly skewers was so flavorful and tender. The Alaskan King crab was so decadent. The lobster tempura was out of this world. The Chilean sea bass was superb. The Madagascar prawn was so sweet and fresh. The Wagyu ribeye topped with shaved truffles was outstanding. The dessert sampler was so mind blowing. The coconut custard with mango and papaya was so amazing. My husband who doesn't really enjoy dessert claimed that that was the best dessert he ever tasted. This place is definitely a must for foodies. It's not cheap so if you're looking for a bargain, this place  is not for you. Service was very attentive.

xKTbEZbz1r_wVzE0-WhwQA.text: I would be an Ass hole not to give Zumba the 5 stars. I made a reservation on our 10 year anniversary trip to Vegas for a Wednesday night at 10.  We arrived early and they took us in. Waiter came by after 5 minutes and we ordered drinks I had a bitter and sour that was great and had me feeling real good my wife had a non alcoholic drink with orange and pineapple she said it was so good she had 2.  We waited about 15 minutes and ordered the waiter was very helpful. We ordered the tuna and salmon tartare and it was possible the best one I have ever had paired really well with sea weed chips and scallions. The tuna would melt in your mouth. We also had the steak with shisito peppers this one was average but paired really well. It's is something I can later do myself on the grill. The next plate we ordered was the wagyu and truffles it also had an aioli sauce to dip in I thought they were pretty good but a waste of wagyu because the wrap over powers the taste, my wife didn't like these I ate about 4 to her one.  We finished off with 2 rolls from the sushi menu the better one in my opinion was the wagyu beef sushi with truffle you can taste everything so chew slow.  The second one was Prikori Nagyro and it contained tuna with green chili, spicy mayo and tobiko. This one was my wife's favorite the waiter brought us ponzu sauce aside from the soy sauce we had on the table. We finished with a desert not on the menu it contained vanilla ice and a hot little chocolate cake that had melted chocolate inside the hot and cold always pairs really well.  Overall I would go again this place is worth the price so be prepared.

oLgyut90PE08h5NkkUl56A.text: Food quality and presentation were good, but our service kind of fell apart fairly quickly.

QWZhPWUoMYX2dhNIjeojsg.text: We were lucky enough to attend the "Friends & Family" pre-opening event with our friends. The moment you walk into Zuma, the experience is beyond amazing! The restaurant design and decor is breathtaking. The service is impeccable. The food and drinks are "wow" level.   We started at the bar and it was mesmerizing watching the bartenders work passionately to make their signature craft cocktails. The Geisha Smash is the drink to get. We had 3! Smooth and all the flavors balanced perfectly. I also had a signature drink that was comparable to a Salty Dog, I forget the drink name, and it was a cloudy pink drink that was quite tasty as well.  We tried a bit of everything on the food menu and we got a good variety. I don't think we had a bad dish in the bunch, and we had many different dishes. I apologize as I don't remember all details of the menu items but can label accordingly once the menu is posted. My favorites were the thinly sliced sea bass with salmon roe, king crab, hot pot mushroom rice, lobster, corn on the cob, soft shell crab sushi, branzino, passion fruit dessert, molten chocolate dessert. So many delicious dishes. I don't think you can really go wrong with anything here.  All in all, we had a very memorable experience and I am so impressed with everything here at Zuma. We may have to get a group together so we can use the group dining area in the back for the view! Thank you to the entire team at Zuma for a lovely night. We really enjoyed everything!

aPXvvXh83OGRlTwglhy1jw.text: This restaurant look really nice and the food got out quickly. My first order was the salmon and tuna tartare. The tartare was surprisingly good and different. My second order was 5 chef sushi special. At first I wasn't going to order the sushi but I am so glad that I did because it was fresh. They also have amazing deserts (plant especially) and really great atmosphere!! Staff is very friendly and amazing service! Pleasant experience, I will be back for sure!!

RXGZPB3NIXO9Aqx-hePsOQ.text: If you're on a comp and don't feel like walking to Tao or Barmasa, I guess this place will do in a pinch. But it is not in the league of either of those places. Oh it's a beautiful room -- seems to be there m.o. based on reviews I saw for NY branch -- beautiful building but mediocre service and food.  A lot of things I hated about this place. Mostly around service. Also the bathrooms, but I could write a treatise on why they suck but it's really not a big deal. Ultimately my server knew nothing.  The sushi was a big notch below Tao (where I ate 24 hours ago) and everything cost more than Tao (the sake I had last night is $40 more here).  If I'm paying these prices you'd better nail the service and food and this place does neither. Avoid the fatty tuna caviar roll, it was overhyped, poorly described and not good. My waiter was a fucking moron btw but that's a whole different story. Also the sommelier was extremely unimpressive.

cF-_KxWJH-DztJ51jHPYgQ.text: This place is amazing! I first tried it a year and half ago with some girlfriends and decided to take another one of my friends there since I was back in town. From the look & feel of the place to food and alcohol! The sashimi was fresh thick cuts, and definitively A grade Fish for sure! The servers and hostess are very attentive and knowledgeable of their menu. I even had the green tea banana cake for dessert. Amazing!

p2tOg99-Sigz6BjWB9DS9A.text: Disappointing, and not worth the large price tag. The Chilean sea bass was excellent, and the spicy tofu salad was very good as well. The rest ranged from mediocre to terrible. One of our sushi rolls looked excellent on paper, but it tasted like a soggy, cold, undifferentiated mass of glop when it got in your mouth. Not worth the price tag!

YhH84wDrtnBEyrsyu0fJfg.text: The annual work-cation, a great excuse/reason to get to the left coast. This was one of 3 restaurants we went to on the strip. It was a mid-weeknight so we didn't experience the full weekend scene. Staff and drinks were solid. Only complaint was the waitress seemed to forget about us about halfway through. We were at a high top tucked in the corner, but there were others around us so it wasn't like we were out of the way. That being said, there were 2 items that shined and would be a reason to go back, the wagyu sushi and the hamachi cold dish. Both are not to be missed. Thanks to Bullock and the corporate card for making it that much more enjoyable.

6ZXyGvqhH2vWWa4dkSx-eA.text: Are there last Thursday and Saturday my groups spent nearly $5000 total. I was lied to and did not receive Cosmo points because my friends also chipped in for dinner. Very disappointing experience.

cXaT7A3nKV_37hakXbBdig.text: I have been to Zuma in Miami, London, HK, NYC and now- Vegas. Thank you chef Hisa-san for amazing food experience! The best!

KsPcXmkmVzoaEfFQWEEbLQ.text: Wow.  Food was fabulous.  Celebrity Chef Bobby Flay and his party of four sat at the table next to us.  That's an extra star.

nJMFt7sZ96d76l8jvirKmQ.text: My favorite night in Vegas!! This place was awesome. The highlight of dinner was Bryan the amazing bartender. Bryan behind the bar was like watching a Las Vegas show! He brings magic to his drinks and some of his own creations were the bomb!! Thank you Bryan for making this dining experience a once in a lifetime!!

biLHpgtu8esMK_fJNPvMFw.text: Me and my husband love everything about this place, drinks, food, and atmosphere. BUT, we went for a few drinks and dessert last night (NY day) and it was by far the worst experience we've had to date there. We sat at the bar and ordered our normal drinks, my favorite is called the rubabu (which main ingredient is passion fruit), got the drinks and immediately I knew something was wrong with my drink; I asked the bartender if they could remake it because it was too sour and she said "we ran out of the passion fruit liquor part so she had to use an actual passion fruit which made it sour." She did remake it and added something to it to make it less sour but it wasn't the same. This particular bartender made our overall experience horrible; she  took forever to take drink orders, was quiet, not personable, and never offered us water (when we ordered a dessert). I think I was most surprised that they weren't disclosing that they ran out of an important ingredient in many cocktails, I almost wanted to tell people at the bar not to order that drink because of it. Overall I would normally give the restaurant 5 stars, but this last experience really ruined it for me.

tXtyrAq1G5fKTcThwsVMfQ.text: I was in Vegas for a conference and was looking for a quick dinner and good drinks. Zuma was perfect! I sat at the bar. The sushi rolls and drinks were superb! While all of the staff were great, Bryan was top notch. He was friendly, gave great menu recommendations, made delicious drinks, and showcased the artistry of bartending. A fabulous experience overall!

IDAcWqDZEugQauWkicxS_A.text: Here is my review is this fucking shit show in 3 points.  1. It took every party at least 20 minutes after their reservation time to get seated. How do you fuck that up after being in business for more than 2 weeks?  2. It took 20 fucking minutes for them to serve us edamame and miso soup. Lol it's like they had Jack in the back trying to grow his bean stalk. What a joke.  3. Ordered "marinated" chicken wings. I actually asked if these sad excuses for chicken wings were seasoned because they tasted like they were boiled in water.  In summation, this place has a cool vibe but everything about the actual food and service is a joke.

V6iY78RjtVev94-c488DRw.text: Obsessed. I don't even have words for how good the sushi is here. I almost cried. The fatty tuna is mind-melting. My mouth is watering now just thinking about it. We tried a few cocktails too and they were amazing. The one with with citrus (yuzu, I believe) and infused with applewood smoke is incredible!   The only downside is the loud club music they played. It seemed to get louder as the evening went on. It was pretty horrible, but if I closed my eyes as I ate the sushi, I felt like I could teleport to another world and the music would fade away.   This fresh, pricey, creative, and inventive Japanese restaurant is well worth the money if you can splurge. Just do it.

GZetKMKZ6bjxRXfpj3Y2gg.text: Definitely NOT the best sushi / Japanese place in town  DECOR:   Fabulous.  Lux.  The bar is made out of Monkey Pod wood.   Yes.. Monkey Pod.  Gorgeous   PEOPLE:   Wanna be trend setters.  Convention attendees.  People blowing their casino winnings.  Drunk but well dressed people.   Music:  lounge & Ibiza fusion really nice  VIBE:  hustle, bustle, loud music & obnoxious patrons   FOOD:  adequate.  Beef dishes chewy & not tender.   Too many cocktails on menu that are absolutely TOO sweet.  Creative food offerings but rather small and not as top quality ingredient wise as it COULD be.     SERVICE:   Many.  Ratio is probably 1 server to every 10 people and 1 bartender to every 3 people at the bar.   Staffed to the Max but VERY slow and that creates too much tension at the table as everyone tries to fill dead time/wait time with conversation... while staring at everyone else at other tables getting their food.

rFlPniuKTZKL5ZmUlnINcQ.text: Finally got to visit Zuma and I did not disappoint.   The ambiance is beautiful with dark wood, glowing walls with art. The kitchen is open and while we opted for a table, the chef's seating would have been fun.   Of course ordering too much food, we were presented each plate omekase style.  We started with shishito pepper with sesame tofu dipping sauce. The thing about shishito is that you never know which one is hot or not. These babies were grilled up nicely. Anything sesame is always a winner and the tofu gave it a great consistency.   The crispy fried squid, green chili with lime was delicious. Light and almost fluffy, every bite was a hit of food crack!  Two cold plates of the seared beef with soy, ginger, lime and coriander and seared salmon with shiso and lime-soy were  From the charcoal grill the skewered kurobuta pork belly with yuzu mustard miso. Just enough fat for flavor. Also on sticks, the fresh scallops with pickled plum, shiso and butter came with a nice char and so sweet.   For dessert I had the chocolate buddha cake with mango sorbet. It was almost too cute to eat.   The service was steady on and expedited like clockwork. The menu is extensive so I think multiple visits are required!

v9-7tsPuVvI5dunNVYfSgA.text: Mixed experience. Since I had amazing beef and one of the worst sushi rolls. Sat by the bar. Got the menu right away. Got good drink in the meantime. Ordered spicy beef and 2 rolls of sushi. The beef was delicious. Really the meat itself, the way they cook it, and not too spicy. Also the sesame is a great extra to the tastes. The problem was I got it before the sushi. Ok no worries I thought. But then the sushi arrived, the problem was that it wasn't made with soy paper like I asked. So I say if you make a mistake, at least try to improve things and get the right one quickly. It took the. 15 minutes. When I got it it was the last thing I wanted to eat. Just the craving was long gone.

n270MjEMM6iN3NpPgdgr0w.text: Amazing! We had the view overlooking the strip. The food was some of the best food I have eaten!   1) edamame Chile - are the best  2) cold dishes with the sea bass- amazing texture!  3) salmon teriyaki - the portion was huge and cooked to perfection!  4) sweet corn - it's a must get!  5) potato - another great small plate!  6) the vegetable roll - so fresh tasting.  7) the ribs- the meat was sooo tender.   It was the best food I've had in Las Vegas!

SJl4LrRXUjkUZl7GxJF8KA.text: Elegant, delicate, fresh, with in-house sommelier, impressive wine list and a quiet, not too sophisticated atmosphere. Everything you want from a good sushi restaurant. You can watch the sushi chef working in front of you for extra entertainment.

F5g8PYHa5wfcu6wXJLSZvQ.text: Where to begin?  The moment you walk in you're in an enchanted forest with wood tables and details, all enhanced but the striking tree 'growing' in the middle full of blossoming pink flowers. Don't miss out on a picture with this beautiful background.   The ambiance is sexy-chic, not overdone, not too loud.   The service: if you're lucky enough you'll have Nature check you in for your reservation, then Regina will take your drink orders and provide the BEST menu suggestions - everything was as she said it would be: perfect. The managers Svetlana and Jed even came by to ensure our group was happy and having a good time! Everyone made us feel so special that evening!  Food recommendations:  The HOT POT is a MUST. And it's a very generous dish so plan to share among 3-4 people.   Black Cod melts in your mouth.  Dumplings were a great appetizer.  Any meat skewed off the Robata grill section is perfection.  Lobster tempura.   Drink: from the cocktail list the passion fruit martini was a hit. They also make a mean espresso Martin.   Dessert- just share the whole platter! Promise you won't be disappointed.

R9_MR8imBh-AJJx7JZ8Bjw.text: Came here, was slightly disappointed.  Really liked a spicy roll with a dollup of wasabi. Also enjoyed the bass, sashimi bass was ok with truffle.  too much truffle.  Cooked fish was decent. Scallops had great sauce, but just ok.

_3z92EyE4mmPqofWhpcPQg.text: I was in Vegas for a couple of days and was more than happy to be able to check off some of my old bookmarks! I've heard about this particular Japanese Tapas/Robata grill place for a while and was excited to go try it since I was staying at the Cosmopolitan. It was just a jump, skip, and a hop away from me.   Zuma is located on South Las Vegas Blvd. right on the strip. It's inside of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino on the third floor. I believe there's validation at the front entrance if you're driving there.   Just like the hotel itself, Zuma is a trendy and upscale Japanese restaurant with large windows facing the street. There's a bar area in the front for drinks and customers can also order food there. The interior is spacious with many small and big tables. The ambience is darkish with a lot of mood lighting which is pretty much the norm for a lot of the restaurants inside the Cosmopolitan. There's a raw bar on one side of the restaurant and another cooking and Robata Grill station on the other side. We were seated right away. (It wasn't really crowded on a Tuesday night.) Our server was both polite and kindly suggested a couple of dishes he liked himself. We ordered a few to share and got some tasty cocktails too. When in Vegas.....  Overall I would definitely go back and try more of their other dishes like the Robata meats, skewers, and signature dishes. They have so many delicious looking dishes on the menu, I'm sure there's something for anyone's discerning tastes.   Lychee & Rose Petal Martini : I was hesitant in ordering this, but I was pleasantly surprised. I thought it was going to be too sweet. Instead it as the right amount of fruit flavor to alcohol. I had two of these. : ) If you like fruity cocktails, this is the one for you.   Steamed Baby Spinach w/ Sesame Dressing : This was good. It's a cold dish. The sesame was all mixed into the spinach, but I still wished there were more of the dressing.   Prawn & Black Cod Dumplings : This dish seemed like a favorite here so we ordered it. It's similar to Chinese Fish Dumplings except with Black Cod. If you like fish dumplings, you'll like this dish.   Japanese Sweet Corn w/ Shiso Butter : This was a good side to order. The corn were all slathered in butter. I had to floss majorly bad after but it was worth it. : )  King Crab w/ Ponzu Lime Butter : This was one of their Robata Seafood items. I love King Crab so I had to order this. This isn't a big portion; probably about one leg. The ponzu lime butter really makes the dish. I loved dipping the king crab into the sauce! If you're there with a group, I'd suggest ordering more than one for the table.   Green Tea & Banana Cake w/ Coconut Ice Cream & Peanut Toffee Sauce : This was delicious! I'm glad I picked it from all the other desserts on the menu. The presentation was on point too. The thin slices of banana on top was a nice touch. The coconut ice cream was light and smooth. However the green tea part was only a thin layer on the bottom of the banana cake so that was a letdown. I feel like they should've at least have half of it be green tea.

pV1BXRXVHyeE0mLHqCgkNQ.text: Izakaya dishes and sake! The menu is so varied that we didn't even see the sushi listed on the back. For the most impressive and tantalizing items, order off the robata grill menu! We really enjoyed the tartare starter with both salmon and tuna. The presentation was prefect (see all the yelp pics) but know that the chips break easily so you have to spoon the fish onto them. There was so much to eat, but my favorite was the giant prawn - they really ARE giant and apparently flown in from Madagascar. The meal was paced well -- you aren't bombarded with plates and the server pays attention to your drinks and takes plates away at the right times.   If you love sake they have quite a selection! I prefer chilled nigori (cloudy sake) and even tried sparkling sake for the first time here. They have a sake expert going around the room if you need advice!   The bill was higher than I estimated, but quality and service was excellent. I would definitely return the next time I am in Vegas.

izjIQ-23z_EXQLtiSYUppQ.text: Located on the 3rd level of The Cosmopolitan Hotel, this is a great restaurant for many different occasions/celebrations. It's perfect for bachelor/bachelorette parties, dinner before a night on the town, company dinners, or a date night. Restaurant lighting was dimmed but still light enough to see your food/significant other's face with the perfect mood music to set the night.  Yes the food was pricey but the quality and presentation of it sure makes up for it. We ordered so many dishes but we really couldn't pick a favorite because they were all that good!!!  For appetizers we ordered: -shishito peppers -prawn and black cod dumplings -crispy fried calamari -Hamachi usuzukuri pirikara which is yellowtail sashimi with green chili relish with ponzu and pickled garlic  From the Robata Grill section we got: -yaki taraba gani-king crab with ponzu lime butter (see attached photo.)  We also got a couple orders of spicy tuna rolls and special rolls.  And that dessert platter....OH MY GOODNESS. That freakin presentation man.....wow. Yeah, it was normal dessert items with gelatos, mixed fruits, chocolate cake but my favorite item there was the ginger bread. I thought it was monkey bread at first because the texture and flavor was similar. Loved that cinnamon baked into the breading.  If I ever get the chance to dine here again, I definitely will. No hesitations. I would love to take my out of town fam/friends here for a dinner.

JEiz0UQ1Y_JYS1RrArp7zQ.text: We ordered the Omakase signature option (the least expensive at $138 pp) and the experience was amazing. Much to our liking the dishes came out rapid fire like a True Izakaya. There were so many fantastic dishes it was hard to keep track. My Japanese wife said it was like her mom's dishes, only better. High praise indeed! We especially liked how perfectly prepared the sushi rice was. It's a small detail that set this place above the fray. The only negative was our experience with the sommelier. If anyone at Zuma reads this, here are some tips for him to step up his sake technique: 1. Sake isn't wine but you're treating it that way. You don't "taste" sake before you pour. It doesn't go bad like wine so tasting before pouring is a bit silly and weird. 2. Proper manners dictate serving and receiving sake with both hands when someone else is pouring. Don't tell people to put their glass back down on the table like you did. 3. It's not wine so you don't have to keep pouring it for us. Leave it within reach or on the table which is the proper way. The cups are tiny so you'll be pouring constantly! Luckily our waiter corrected this faux pas. Step up your sake game and this is an easy 5 stars. wikihow.com/Serve-and-Dr...

j8scXg2BP26dHUugYZST3w.text: Was completely mesmerized from start to finish! The boyfriend and I came here for our valentines dinner. He requested window seating upon making the reservation and they were able to accommodate - on top of it being Valentine's Day! Another amazing thing is that they didn't seem to overbook, which made us not feel rushed at all. I work at a restaurant so I know how busy it can get but it was very comfortable :)  So now the service and food. The service was amazing, our waitress gave us really good suggestions, our waters were always filled, everyone was extremely friendly! And like I stated, service was not rushed at all!  For drinks, we ordered their rose & lyhee martini and one of their margaritas. Both were tasty!  The food WAS PHENOMENAL!! So so yummy. We had the calamari, which was seasoned SO perfectly. So perfect in fact, that it didn't come with sauce because it didn't even need it! Just sprinkle some lime on it. We also had their spicy tuna maki roll. So so good. The quality of the fish was there!! And the last appetizer we ordered was their shrimp and cod dumplings. AND WOWZA. Best dumpling I've ever had.  the cod had such a good taste to it. For our entrees we shared their wagyu skirt steak and king crab. The wagyu skirt steak was so tender. It came with chimichurri, sea salt, and wasabi on the side, which I wouldn't think to eat with steak but oh mannnn, it made an amazing steak so much better. And the crab had a lemon butter sauce on it and it was so meaty! Lastly, we had their chocolate dessert. It was a chocolate lava cake with a caramel and praline(maybe) sauce  with a vanilla ice cream. It was very sweet, but it definitely topped off my dinner.   Everything was amazing - presentation, service, quality of food, just really great! It truly made my valentines dinner a memorable one!

IEdkpENWsgCe_y6vIoyY-A.text: My husband and I went for my 30th birthday last night. We got the Signature Omakase. We were expecting to leave hungry and I was stuffed before the hot food came out! (Didn't stop me!). There were only a couple staple dishes (sashimi, tempura, and sushi roll), the rest were unique, creative, and delicious. We are SO glad that we went with the Omakase. All of the dishes came out really fast and we were thinking we were going to be done soon after each plate. The food kept coming for almost 2 hours. Dinner was about $450 all in and worth every penny. My favorite had to have been one of the last dishes, Cod (buttery melt in your mouth), the sea bass, or the Spicy filet. But really, it was all fantastic. I ate the entire Japanese man chocolate dessert--  Chocolate/raspberry amazingness. Thank you, Zuma! What an experience in dining!

r4aelI8loYHYK2iZrSVXcw.text: We are the biggest fan for Japanese food and have done many Omakase meals in Japan and in the US. After spending almost $400, we had the most unorganized and uninspiring Omakase ever. It was a lot of food but nothing stood out or wowed us. Can they come up with something not yellowtail in ponzu sauce with jalapenos, miso black cod, and grill scallops? The best dish was the peanut butter cream spinach... Everything was served family style, which is not very Omakase to begin with. Server said it's 5 courses so we expected 5 dishes over 1.5 hours. However, 4-5 small dishes were served so fast in the first 15 mins, to the point where I was like "woh, can we please slow down? Our table is full of food and we didn't expect to finish our Christmas meal in half an hour." Then the server said "these are all your first course and your second course is sushi which will be served shortly after". However there was one more dish before sushi. After the sushi was served, he's like "after this will be your last course, stuff from the grill." I was so confused at that point... so I was at course 2 and all the sudden at the last course? Our server was good but there were too many tables for him to take care of. Normally when we do Omakase, a server takes care of 2-3 tables at most so they can explain the dish and where we are at the course. This is the most non-omakase meal in the name of omakase, merely a mash up of dishes. I have no idea what the chef and management are thinking. If you're severing 10+ dishes, just call it a 10 course meal, which is better advertisement and less confusing. This is a mass production ok quality course meal that's not worth $400. We have no problem spending that money, as long as you're really serving good food and experience. This was neither of those. I don't know what other people's price point is, I don't think my ask is too much. Have some decency and make some improvements to your omakase menu. go to Japan and try some Michelin restaurants' omakase. Otherwise don't call this Omakase. Or maybe call it Omakase for dummies? It was a joke.

5tuRSgnJEdsMQxulcSeisQ.text: We had a great time here. We sat at the table right in front of the chef station, and it was amazing to see all of the chefs focused on their craft. The chefs are extremely dedicated and work non-stop. Our waiter also recommended a cool Smoked Whiskey drink where he actually lit a log on fire in front of us to prepare the drink. I also recommend the Sesame Tenderloin. It was to die for. See picture. I will be returning.

wqTZ3ekX9qoHQKZT8AI53w.text: I have no idea how we slept on this place. I had been to just about all of the restaurants around it, STK, Jaleo, Momofuku, Eggslut, Holstein's... In the 2 years living here, never had tried it till last weekend... Man! So not disappointing! Probably one of the best palate experiences I've had being here... Just amazing food.   There were 4 of us and we went with the Omakasi Signature style choice at $138.00 per person This had the: edamame robata asparagus  spicy fried tofu with avocado and japanese herbs seabass sashimi with yuzu, truffle and salmon roe* sliced seared tuna with chili daikon and ponzu sauce lobster 1 1/2 lb with spicy ponzu and wasabi mayo salmon and tuna Tartare Ribeye with black truffle shavings (Just ridiculously amazing) Black Cod There was an assortment of sushi that was that was on a tiered presentation And an assortment of desserts  The quality of the sushi was up there with Nobu... Just so flavorful!   To drink I had a Japanese Old Fashion, okay maybe 3 of them... Made with Japanese Whiskey -  Suntory Toki  - just amazingly smooth and delicious!  As you can tell by what they served, we weren't hungry when we left. The food and service were just incredible! I cannot wait to come back and try more of what they have!     It is expensive, but so worth the price point! I hope that you enjoy yourselves when you come or have an event here. You won't be disappointed!

0OICRouCNg7MMWBOepQBdg.text: Where does one begin. An eclectic mix of sushi, "New" Japanese dishes and cocktails with a dedicated staff and quality ingredients, a recipe for success. Beef? Check. Lamb? Check. Fatty Tuna? Why not. On top of all of that, an incredible cocktail menu that will make you lose your mind. Do you love taste and presentation? Sit at the prep bar and enjoy the incredible food and the talents of the cooks.

GEddkun0oFo0hmJu-tf98w.text: Excellent addition to the Cosmopolitan. Probably doesn't hurt that it generates more revenue than the art gallery it replaced.  I feel this place has more of a focus on the food than some of the other restaurants in this hotel. Some, without naming names, are more about the scene than the food. Luckily for us, Zuma comes through with excellent food.  The skirt steak came with a cool chimichurri sauce that was pretty good. Every dish comes with salt (himalayan?) on the side. Use very carefully, and don't use a lot, doesn't need that much. The robata skewers crushed it, the chicken wings and the beef with shishito pepper were pretty big and full of flavor. Get sushi if you want but I'd focus on their other dishes, like from the robata, skewers, or the bigger plates.  Handcrafted ice and cocktails sitting in barrels are a few of the more inspired drinks on the menu. I overheard a convo the bartender had about sour beers and my ears perked up. He gave me the beer even though they don't sell it and only use it in cocktails. What a nice gesture!  Do not come here expecting just sushi. It's an izakaya! Sushi is there, but it's not the main event. Enjoy the robata grill and the shared plates.

Buj-XjdNkQfrlVXccJ3lYg.text: Best Sushi and ambiance in Vegas. Service was great, food came out fast cocktails were perfect too!

gS-wTH1jtwQQWoHbAJf1Ew.text: Zuma is a whole vibe y'all. Beautifully decorated. Low lit. They have 3 kitchens serving up freshly made sushi and Japanese treats.   Each seated section has 2 to 3 wait staff within to you catering to your every desire. Well-dressed managers continuously circle to ensure your needs are met.  This spot earns its high end dining reputation with delicious food, amazing atmosphere, and top notch service.

QOEiOczBxAJ6QDpdB3YUnA.text: This restaurant definitely gets 5 stars all across the board, from the point of entrance to the exit .my first experience with this restaurant was in New York. The New York location was bigger than this one but this location still offered a superb dining experience. The ambiance was excellent! Very dim lights with an open kitchen view and awesome decor. The lighting was perfect for dinner! Our sever was James and he was very helpful and knowledgable. Also good looking haha(eye candy and good food cant go wrong). For an app I got the zuma Churashi roll. It was really tasty. Salmon yellow tail sea bass and tuna .excellent combo. I like to have my sushi with eel sauce, try it!  For a main I ordered the grilled sea bass, which James recommended as one of the best dishes on the menu and boy was he right!! It was absolutely amazing. The combination of flavors was excellent!! The one down fall is that it's a small portion with no sides so if you're hungry I definitely recommend some apps or a side order. My friend got the potato which was excellent as well. There were a lot of different addings and James prepared it for us. So good! I absolutely love this restaurant and if you're in the area you have to try it!! There's so much more they offer ranging from steaks to veggies. Everyone can enjoy this place!

lSsC5gs-BoeqZSK0N2BXEg.text: After careful Review of several high end Sushi restaurants we decided to come to Zuma. I was very excited since we walked into the restaurant. Our reservations were at 8 and we were seated by 8:10 so that was t too bad. We requested the sushi bar because they had several seats available and we wanted to get the sushi bar chef experience. Unfortunately aside from the greeting we received when we were seated we never got any eye contact or service from the sushi chef. We just moved on with our night and still had fun. We ordered a nice 300 ml bottle of rocks Saki and we received two shot glasses that were far from clean. Has objects floating inside cup after first pour and it even had some oily residue. You should not expect that when  you go to any restaurant let alone one that you pay $$$ for your dining experience.  The sushi was very good and they brought our meals out quickly with no errors. They deserve a 5 star for quality of food. The Miso soup was average but we didn't go for soup so who cares.  I did order a cappuccino that was pretty watered down with milk and honestly they shouldn't really offer it if they can't make it so make sure to request if you like your cappuccino wet or dry. Desert was awesome and we enjoyed every bite. Only other complaint I had was that service was good but not great for what we paid. A $30 tip was basically at 15% and that was still too much since we didn't really get any attention. You need to remember that my complaint is strictly due to the price we paid for sushi and you pay more for not just the food but entire experience. We weren't the only people annoyed at the sushi bar so they were having some issues tonight.

xvkGH18WPaQiz-xWMnTmFA.text: I had high expectations since I'm a fan of most of the Cosmo restaurants. We ended up on the middle ranged prix fixe which was a great way for a group to try different things. Surprisingly, we were stuffed by the end! Unfortunately, Zuma missed the mark on most things though and I wouldn't return.  GREAT: * Scallops - Huge, delicious, amazing scallops. I'd come back for the scallops every day if I could! * Sea Bass - Delicious flavor, on par with the one I tasted at Hakkasan.   GOOD: * Mushroom rice with truffles - Good but pricey for a small bowl! * Sea bass sashimi  * Sorbet dessert - delicious and refreshing!  MEDIOCRE * Steak - A big portion but a little chewy. Don't come here for the steak. * Corn on the cob - Filler course. * Sushi Platter - very hit or miss in quality.   PASS * Lobster tempura - Bland * Potstickers - unique flavor but wouldn't order again.

EN7c1FS4Rdzcr87UXjJ4Cg.text: Another winning restaurant inside the Cosmopolitan hotel. While pricey, this place makes for the perfect special evening out. My husband and I frequent for birthdays and it's one of our top spots to bring friends from out of town. If you aren't wanting to spend as much, grabbing a seat at the bar, a few of their unique and amazing cocktails, and a few plates to split is also a wonderful experience.   While almost everything here is divine, some of our favorite plates to order are the pork belly skewers, yellowtail and serrano maki roll (spicy and delish), street corn, and the spicy edamame. We've also tried a bunch of their steaks and they are all fantastic.   My favorite cocktail on the strip is also located here. The Lychee Rose Martini. Absolutely amazing, and extremely photogenic. I could drink 5 (although that might end the evening early).   Highly recommend!

E5rjlsB9QGiZc8uBUs1r-w.text: This place is sooo good. The portion sizes are very small, but they are the most delicious bites you will have! Some of the most popular dishes are the tuna/salmon, the spicy beef tenderloin and the king crab which were all great! The tuna/salmon was very fresh and tasty. There are several pictures on yelp, just keep in mind they look a lot bigger than the real size.   The spicy beef tenderloin was perfectly cooked and very rich on flavors. However, my ultimate favorite was the king crab with lemon ponzu sauce which was just amazing! Every bite made me want even more! The ponzu lemon sauce was amazing! We wanted to dip everything in it!!  Another side dish that I would recommend are the shishito peppers and the shiitake mushrooms.   Although the lobster is a very popular dish I would not bother ordering it again!  Overall, this is a great restaurant to try, you will be happy with the food and the atmosphere!

asXFBtSoILnZKW1YyqK31A.text: Zumba sounds a bit Spanish, but it's actually an Asian fusion eatery.   Location: Zuma is located on the second floor of Cosmopolitan.   Parking: I believe Cosmopolitan parking garage gives you free parking for 90 minutes BUT it's best to walk or Uber/Lyft to Zuma if you're on the strip. A bit of exercise before eating will help you enjoy your food ahaha.  Atmosphere: very fine dining. Elegant decors and restaurant looks upscale. So are other restaurants on the strip lol. Most attires are business to dressy here. Try to dress casually nice y'all.   The food: AMAZING and everything just melt in my mouth. They offer meals tasting or a la carte. We did the a la carte, but I think I would do the meal tasting next time I'm there. You pay a bit more and you get variety. It's also nice to sit right around the open kitchen, so we get to see all the actions of how the food were prepared.   We didn't drink there so I don't know.  Overall: I had a good time there. I would go back and it's fine dining so it's expensive. But you get what you pay for.

4gxfmFW4oF_KvhrdY1dRwg.text: This is now one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas! We were able to get reservations on Open Table for our anniversary and were seated promptly when we arrived. Our server, Kim, was great and gave plenty of suggestions on what to try since it was our first time there. We decided on the following:  Piri Karai Edamame - stir fried soybeans with chili, garlic and ginger  Tempura Moriawase - seafood & vegetables   Robata Beef Rib Eye - rib eye steak (12 oz) with chili ponzu (med-rare)  Japanese Grade A5 Wagyu - wagyu beef with tahoon aioli and chili daikon ponzu fresh wasabi (med-rare)  Jagaimo no Marugoto Robata Yaki - roasted potato with shiso butter and sancho lime salt  Chawan Mushi - exotic fruits   Everything was SO good! The tempura came out nice and hot and the prawns tasted very fresh. The rib eye was delicious with some char on the ends and perfectly cooked. The roasted potato was really a big baked potato and our server mashed it up for us tableside with the butter and salt (that's some serious crack butter - it's addicting) but the A5 Wagyu was the star of the night! Our first time eating A5 and it was AMAZING! It was sliced thin and came with three different kinds of salt along with the two sauces to dip in - just melts in your mouth with tons of flavor! The chawan mushi desert was also good and the Happy Anniversary script added a special touch. Can't wait to come back!

I live close by and dine quite often in the Miami location so I figured I'd give the Vegas location a try.   What I love about Zuma is they just do everything right. The Food is amazing and always consistent. Doesn't matter what you order everything is just so damn flavorful and delicious. Quite honestly I've never had a bad experience. The Food is prepared with high quality ingredients and the execution just flawless. My all time favorite is their black cod, the tuna and salmon tartar, wagyu beef and the sushi. Just Never gets old and I order it all the time.   My experience at the Vegas location was exceptional. The Service and atmosphere was great too 5/5.

rAlqrgubPb3SDOG4uYqlVg.text: So my friends and I decided to go all out and do the Signature OMAKASE for $139 per person. You can also do ala carte and order random items from the menu. Yes, the food here is pricey, but so are many of the other restaurants at the Cosmo.  The quality of the food was great, but what really stood out to me was the presentation of the food/drinks and the ambiance. The kitchen areas are open and the restaurant had lots of dark wood decor.  If I remember correctly, it was a 12 course meal with a special "birthday" dessert platter that was huge! I wish I took a picture of it. We were soo full by the end that we didn't even finish all the sweets. Two of the people at our table do not eat meat and they were still able to enjoy the many dishes. There are vegetarian/vegan options on the menu.   All of the food we got was delish, but my 2 favorites were the miso cod which just melts in your mouth and the beef tataki with black truffle. Anything truffle is a winner to me. My japanese old fashioned drink was soo good that I drank 2! They chip off a square piece of ice from a large ice block and then imprint ZUMA on your square ice cube. Service is fast and on point.   All I wanna do is zuma zoom zoom zoom and a boom boom.......go check this place out!

K7d0-b3TcrGXbds2PU0MYg.text: Absolutely impeccable meal from beginning to end. The decor is beautiful and stylish, with a dark, softly lit interior and ceiling lights above each table (perfect for getting that 'gram =P). Great spot for a special occasion or date night, my friends and I stopped by for dinner before heading to the Celine Dion show.   My group of 3 had the following: - sliced yellowtail, green chili relish, ponzu and pickled garlic - so fresh and tart with a delicious crunch from the garlic - salmon roll - mixed salad with asparagus, avocado, seaweed and sesame seeds - refreshing and crisp, so good that we ordered a 2nd bowl after finishing the 1st! - grilled scallops with pickled plum, shiso and mentaiko butter - buttery, tender, and delicious - shiitake mushroom with garlic and soy butter - full of umami flavor and super garlicky, luckily we love garlic! - japanese sweetcorn with shiso butter - delicious but messy - jumbo tiger prawn with yuzu pepper - probably my least favorite dish (but only because everything else was so tasty!). The texture of the meat was just a bit too chewy, and may have been slightly overdone. - black cod - wow the absolute highlight of our meal, the fish was so tender and flaky that it melted in our mouthes, and the flavor with the dipping broth was just perfect  Sadly, we had no time (and no room in our stomaches) for dessert, but all in all a great experience!

HCgF7wZpRskbJouOqteYSg.text: Zuma was the only restaurant was on my 'must-try' list during my visit to Vegas because one of my friend who travels the world plenty (he's in South Africa as of the date of this review) had told me that Zuma served one of the best steaks that he'd ever had anywhere. Obviously I had to give it a try, right?  I made a reservation to dine here at 6:00 pm. It was an early dinner because I had to go to an event at 8:00 pm. The restaurant was pretty empty around this time so a reservation was definitely not needed. But to be on the safe side, I made it anyway.  Arriving at the restaurant, we were greeted by a super friendly hostess who made conversations about my name before we were taken to our table.  Despite the many empty tables in the restaurant at this time, we were seated next to another couple who were dining in. I usually wouldn't have an issue with this if the distance between tables were pretty far. However, there was probably only about one foot separating the two tables so it felt more like sitting a fast food sitting. If you go through their pictures, you'll see what I mean.  Our waiter came up to our table almost immediately. He explained the menu and was quick to answer any question we had about the menu and also making recommendations of what we should try. Throughout our dining experience, he was friendly, attentive, and on point. No complaints whatsoever about him.  Zuma is pretty much a Tapas restaurant where everything on the menu is small portioned so it allows you to order different menu items to try.  - Spicy lobster miso soup: I didn't try this but my friend thought that the Miso soup was really good. - Sake marinated chicken wings, sea salt and lime: Delicious! One of the better chicken wings that I've had. The marinade definitely got soaked through the chicken. The meat was both crispy and tender. Squeeze the lime on top of the chicken and then dip it in salt and this is a chicken wing you have to try! Highly recommended. - Crispy fried calamari with serrano pepper and lime: Pretty good but it didn't really have the 'wow' factor that would separate it from other high-end restaurants. - Rock shrimp tempura with chili tofu: probably my least favorite dish of the night; it was just okay. Without the dipping sauce, the shrimp tempura tasted kind of bland to me. If you're thinking about trying this, I would recommend against it.  The main course of the night was the Japanese Grade 5 Wagyu Steak. It was marked as 'market price' so we asked our waiter what the market price and it was $33/oz with a minimum 4 oz order. We decided to order the 4 oz to split it between the two of us. At first, we thought that 2 oz each wouldn't be nearly enough and we were contemplating about ordering a rib eye or beef tenderloin, but it's a good thing we didn't. By the time we were done with the other dishes, the 2 oz of steak was plenty enough for each of us.  The steak was served medium rare (just like any steak should be) and was already sliced up to make it easy to share. The steak was cooked to perfection: crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and buttery in your mouth.  Zuma was the third restaurant where I'd tried Japanese Wagyu steak (Metropolitan Grill in Seattle, Killen's Steakhouse in Pearland) and let me tell you that it was probably as good as, if not better than the others. I mean, I'd have to try all of them side by side to really tell but whatever.  If you've never tried Japanese Wagyu steak, you should. If at all possible, you should try Japanese Wagyu steak side by side with a USDA prime steak so you can really appreciate how much better the Japanese Wagyu is. I wish Zuma had actually made that option available (This option was available at both the Metropolitan Grill and Killen's Steakhouse).  All in all, I enjoyed the majority of my meals. However, due to the price point, I expected every single one of my dish to be mind blowing. This wasn't the case here. I wouldn't mind going back to try some of the other stuff they had on their menu.  P.S. Yes, I know I didn't try any sushi, but I came here specifically for the steak and not the sushi.

T3leeat_NXYcYFM_OixPvQ.text: Cool spot, but for the price it was just okay. These are tapas style courses which the courses are super small so be sure to order a little more for the table to share. This place also gets super busy, so make sure you make a reservation.   I loved their Wagyu sushi with truffle on top. That was sooo good that I had to order another one, but it was $25 for 2 small pieces. Something about the Wagyu with the crunchy radish rap and the generous slice of truffle on top was an amazing combo. I could of had 10 of these.   Their Alaskan king crab leg was just okay. Their giant grilled prawn was dry and had no flavor.   I loved the miso cod, that was my favorite dish of the night.   The rib eye was just okay as well.   Overall the service was good, atmosphere was cool, but it was very pricey for what you get. Expect to spend at least $300 for 2 people. Each plate was around $40 for what we ordered.

9WXeLZlwWEhkjv40UinwgQ.text: Came back for a third time. This place does not disappoint. The consistency of the food is impeccable. Everything tasted the way it should. I can't say one bad thing about this place.  Service is 5 Star. Every time our cups were half empty they would fill it back up. As soon as a plate was done they would take it away. Everything just kept moving like a well oiled machine. Very attentive staff. And last but not least when I wanted the check...it was brought to me and closed within 3 minutes. I love fast service. Definitely going back a fourth.

t0UJW5saw4d1z6ZNOrvF4Q.text: Had a amazing dinner with top notch service from Brian & Jose at the bar.  Although we had made reservations, we were being so well taken care of & having such fun talking to Brian &Jose we decided to eat dinner at the the bar.  Their food recommendations were spot on.  We started off with a BURNING HISTORY cocktail.  The crafting & presentation of the drink was a Vegas show in itself!  Jose filled a glass with smoke from a burning stave from a seasoned from a whiskey barrel.  He then added a hand crafted ice cube, house dehydrated orange, and sun Tori took whiskey shaken with honey, ginger, yuzu, and egg whites.  Delicious!  I would also recommend asking for a Penicillin Shot (not on the menu): Scotch, lemon, fresh ginger, & honey).  Favorites:  SPICY BEEF TENDERLOIN  GIANT PRAWN ROBATA SHITAKE MUSHROOMS PORK BELLY SKEWER  You can't beat the great service, the positive energy, the fresh flavors and quality foods at Zuma.  One of if not the best meals I've had in Las Vegas.  Thank you Jose & Brian!  See you soon.

yGnGeJz7-s2yiQFRdjSzCw.text: Food was ok but I dont recommend it due to the service. We are vegetarian and the server wanted to push extra plates I'm guessing to increase our bill. The place has a nice decoration but the pushy waiter made us just want to finished our 2 rolls and leave. We had appetizers and drinks as well, and I would have order more but I was tired of how rude the server was. They had a tasting kind of option but it wasn't vegetarian so we decided to go a la cart and I think that was the waiters problem when we decided the fixed price menu was not for us. Find better places. Not your place to go.

DchEF45sNJy8Xb6F_IZGqQ.text: Everything is bigger and better in Vegas right?   Well if you take the True spirit of an Izakaya (simple tasty dishes to make you drink more and relax) and amped it up 3 levels and tripled the price then Zumba fits right in.   First atmospherics, the custom groove music playlist perfectly volume synced to the crowd buzz level? Check.  Ample service team running around supervised by aloof/hipster floor managers? Yup.  High end dining room dark enough so you can't read the menu prices? That's the plan.  And most important a beehive of customers shelling out American moolah by the Ben Franklins. That's the whole idea.   I must say that besides good food and on point service, the most important part of creating a great dining experience is You!  And a lot more beautiful people like you!   The energy in a dining room comes from the customers who animate and fill the place with buzz.  That's the magic elusive ingredient that blends and masks everything to a smooth endorphin feeling meal.  Ok, so Zuma got all of that in spades.  Food.   Above average sushi bar.  Once you got two choices for Toro (chuu and oo) you know they got the Chefs and suppliers from the A level to make almost everything.  Another markers is Japanese uni (Hokkaido) vs. the us west coast version.  Smaller darker gonads that are more sweeter and intense without the funkiness than their bigger American cousins.   So give the sushi bar a A-.  What's missing is 4-5 unique kinds of fish or shellfish.  They did have kimidai which is a kind of snapper and their scallops are from Hokkaido so they do get points.  Kitchen does a great job with a wide and diverse menu.   Mixing Robata, tempura and hot dishes in with the usual high end starters.  As others have said, kind of riffs on Morimoto or Nobu signature dishes.  Nothing super new and I personally did not like the basil/shiso flavoring of their creamier gratin dishes.  Miso Porkbelly skewers did stand out in my mind.  Also the giant grilled prawn a better choice than the lobster.  Another A-.   At this price and execution level you can't really go wrong with any dish.   Bar. Now here they get a solid A!   Very creative and eclectic menu for cocktails.  Got to get the Burning History.  Kind of a Japanese whisky sour complete with torched MaCallan whisky stave.   And hand chipped clear ice to boot!  This was done well and at tableside for the ohhh factor.  Another one is the fish in the bag gin tonic presentation.  Winna! So if you got some cash to burn it's better to waste it here than lose it on the first floor.   At least you will have a full tummy and a great fun memory.  All you get downstairs is regrets!

vpOyLUN0hWa2C5p2nAwQjA.text: This place was absolutely amazing from beginning to end. We had a large group and they were able to comfortably accommodate us on a Saturday night. The food was not only beautifully presented but delicious. There was not a single bad item. Everything was so good, but I would definitely recommend the skewers and dessert. If nothing else, get the lava cake and custard dessert. I've never had a more delicious lava cake... it was probably the best I've ever had any where. The custard was so amazing with the matching fruit puree. Just thinking about it makes me drool.   The service was also amazing. They really want you to have a wonderful experience and work to accommodate all your requests (even adjusting the air to reduce draft to the table).   This restaurant definitely shot to the top of my restaurant list and would recommend to anyone looking for an amazing dining experience accompanied by melt in your mouth food!

_tOeMOmVdgd5dTm-LKfDvA.text: ii've had this place two times in a row hoping both experiences wouldve been the same. unfortunately the second time we ate here at the sushi bar was NOT as good as when we first ate at the regular bar with Songha as our server and bartender. Great selection of alkie mostly anything with whiskey they have a great selection of Japanese whiskey.  as for the food great spot for veggie options i loved every single one the shitake mushrooms and the fried tofu with avocado salad are my faves the asparagus skewer is good  but whatever u do dont order the seafood veggie tempura unless u dont mind having that last it took about 1.5hrs to get it just be warned it is good once it comes out but not worth the wait.   the salmon and fat tuna tar tar is great when u scoop it and put it on the nori shirmp rice crackers . and if u like to be adventurous try the uni my fiance said it was one of the best unis she's had because it didnt have that slimy after taste. regular bar service great sushi bar service was meh seems like ur not on priority of service like i felt i was out of site out of mind. but great spot for music with good veggie options 2 out of 5 first time i ate it was a high 4 but with the how long it took for the tempura to come out i averaged out the 2 Nd 4 to a 3  let's start off with the alkie the best selection of jap

wJxMtAkUQlAyWO4tEmv1ww.text: My wife and I came to Zuma last week for her birthday after a friend of ours said this place was on fire - boy, was he right!   One of the coolest and most sophisticated bars in Vegas! All of the cocktails feature their hand cut/crushed crystal clear ice! (Not to mention fresh fruits and herbs with top shelf liquor)   After having a few drinks at the bar, we were escorted to our table. They easily transferred our bar tab to our table which was very convenient and quick.   We started with edamame and shishito peppers which were both phenomenal and then moved on to sole Sake and sushi.   Finished off with their Ribeye steak which was served sliced in a modern Japanese fashion with seat salt and house made wasabi. This was honestly one of the best steaks I've ever had!   Everything Zuma does, they do it 110% - Amazing chefs, high quality ingredients and attention to every detail. 5 stars for Zuma, we can't wait to go back!

nv64Y9XPGwcQ7E07MsFzQA.text: My wife ordered a lamb and she wanted it fully cooked because she is pregnant so she cannot eat anything raw.   The lamb came, I took one bite and she took another. We noticed the lamb actually medium rare. We informed our waiter about that the lamb should be fully cooked.  Our waiter took the plate and talked to the manager. Moments later, the lamb came back to us when we almost already for the desert.   At this time, the lamb is fully cooked; however, they used the same piece of the lamb that was originally served to us in the first place. I understand that it makes sense not to waste the food by getting a new piece of the lamb for us. But, for a 5 star restaurant, I would expect that the would be on top of their service and I expected to receive a good experience from them. The worst part is, no one ever apologizes to us about the mistake, and the food never comps for.   We went to a less expensive restaurant on the strip before, and they would give comp a meal to us when a mistake like this happens.   Our bill was about $350. They served us a used lamb at a 5 start restaurant, and no one seems to care including the manager.

N4VGreko7VngU_Bdf_L0ZA.text: After dining here I do not think I will come back again. The portion was small. I got the cod, uni and unagi sashimi 2 pieces each, soft shell crab and the molten chocolate cake for dessert. I left with my stomach half empty. Don't give me wrong the food was tasty and well made but for the price they charge I expect you can walk out the place satisfied. Seriously if you want to charge $20 for 2 pieces of sashimi/sushi I think it's just ridiculous. Service and ambience was good but the music they played in there was loud and can't really have a great conversation. There are better places to have Japanese food than here.

9FpNUE5YMnTBaTSGgFpzRw.text: Researched a ton of restaurants on the Strip and this was at the top of my list.  We ventured in without a reservation and were seated at the Robata grill.  Our server (Jeremy?) was wonderful, and selected the Rib Eye Steak with wagu sauce when we were torn between 2 beef dishes.  AMAZING.  I work with a lot of caterers so I recognize quality. The beef was incredibly tender and paired perfectly with the sauce.  We also loved the Chilean Seabass.  Happy to learn they are opening more locations around the country.  Will definitely return!

IiNkAhK9-4IZSuEX2Ffr2w.text: We spent our Anniversary here recently and had the best time!! We had the Chef's Premium tasting menu and were so happy we did!! Every dish was So Delicious!!! Our waiter was great too!! I highly recommend Zuma for an amazing dinner with service to match!! And the desert they brought us for our Anniversary was Superb!!

9kU4tTopJAnGGdV-QfEXow.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants I've been to. Just be prepared to spend$$$$.   Drinks: all delicious  Shots: green tea shot & kamakazi- more cocktail style so u can even sip on it in my case.   Burning history: must get!!!! The smoked cedar wood in front of you. Then fill the glass with the smoke: add large ice cube and a dried candies citrus and the drink. It's so delicious and you can smell the Yuzu and cedar. I was so impressed especially thAt it tasted DELICIOUS    Tapas/ dishes Caviar and champagne: good enough for 4 to share. Came with variety of condiments and cracker. Good but not my fave. Champagne was enough for 1/2 glass for 4 or full glass for 2.   Edamame was regular so don't order.   Grilled pepper: decent but didn't care too much for it.   Octopus: tender can order sashimi style or with rice. We did both. But ate before I got the pic.   Rib eye steak with garlic chips : already cut up. Good flavors and very tender. Garlic chips are delicious and complimentary in flavor and texture   Soft shell crab: so good with the sauce. One of the better places with soft shell crab slightly battered and fried.   Pork belly: I know it's fatty but it was so good and melted in your mouth. Must try if u eat pork. The sauce that it came with was perfectly complimentary in flavor to offset the fatty taste.   Asparagus: Al dente the way I like it. I just needed some veggies  Sea bass carpaccio: take the fish eggs and put some in the sea bass and eat it with the micro greens. Good flavors and texture.   The picture of the dessert was not ours but a nearby table. But it looked so good that I couldn't resist asking for a pic. We were so stuffed with food and drinks and in time crunch so we didn't order more.   Must try!!!!

a7Is7AUq-fy-48bHcJ9A5Q.text: My photos will not tell you anything you do not already know.  The review by Mi S perfectly describes the portions and pricing model which is somewhat expected at any high rent/high tourist location.  The service here is outstanding.  The food is generally tasty.  It is a four star establishment based on the location factors the owner must deal with, the overall quality of the food, and the very responsive service.  Why a single star?  EASY - the policy at a place like this to not be able to make a simple, custom roll is absurd.  You can see I have many reviews from sushi joints and have never been denied this standard request:  *  Inside please put Saki, Hamachi, Crab, and Avocado. *  Outside please put Eel with light Unagi sauce.  Response from waitress "We don't do that."  "Our chefs can only remove ingredients from what is on the menu but not add or make anything special."  I asked "why?"  Response "They just don't like to do that."  What happened to "the customer is king" or "the customer is always right."    When paying the prices for this place, I would think they could take simple roll order, slap a $35 dollar cost to it, and JUST MAKE IT.  But no, it is easier to not give the people ACTUALLY EATING THE DINNER what they want.  First time I have put all caps in a review, sorry but so limiting from wanting to make people spend big $$$.  My bill was still $550 for only three people by the way.  Poor policy, especially for what is supposed to be a "nice" place.

DQtZtHCisIBbt2sYD7CTjQ.text: This restaurant is gorgeous!  Just decorated and appointed so wonderfully I would want to live inside of it.    Wonderful service.  We were treated like kings.  I hate when servers try to sell you the highest costing items to drive the bill up.  Our server did the opposite.  She asked us what we liked and then helped us navigate what to get.  It was also my friends birthday and literally EVERYONE came by to wish her a happy birthday.  She even got it while we were walking out.  If that doesn't make you feel special and appreciated, I don't know what will.  The food here is incredible.  Perfect flavor balances with fresh, high quality ingredients.  I thought it was priced fairly well for a sushi spot on the Strip as well.    The cocktails... I want to come back (and have to spend the night btw) to try every single cocktail.  The mixologist here is a magician.    I CANNOT wait to come back and experience this amazing restaurant again.

MfdWXfoG07bfU35gErJ1Ww.text: Came on a Tuesday night for dinner and place was quit pack. We came in without reservations, but didn't have to wait long to be seated. Restaurant is located in the Cosmopolitan hotel on the 3rd floor. Place is pretty sleek and fancy. They do have three areas where the foods are being prepared. They have a sushi bar with seating and a yakatori/grill bar with seating as well. We were sat at the yakatori bar and got to watch all the action. Pretty neat watching all the meats and veggies being cooked.   We were press for time so didn't get to order as many dishes as we would like. We did order two rolls, soft shell and fattie tuna as well as the grill cod. Sushi rolls are your traditional typical rolls. The black cod was a bit fishy, but otherwise flaky and buttery. They do have a huge sake selection. Our waiter was very friendly and welcoming. He was kind enough to give us sampling of the sake before ordering. Overall, place was ehhhh ok, but for the price I would rather spend it somewhere else.

I tried so many different things- from tempura crab to various sashimis, to rolls, to massive scallops to juicy steak!   It was definitely too much food, but we were warned and slowed down, literally just tasting the last few dishes. Everything was so delicious, especially the sashimi, and the service was outstanding! Wow, I would totally come back here again, omakase or otherwise!

UCAXm0STPd2fEbpYV4Hf8g.text: After referring multiple friends to eat here, it was finally our turn to go- celebrating my son's membership to teenage years.  He wanted high end sushi/Japanese. This place didn't disappoint. We think it's better than Morimoto.   Ambience is cool. Noise level is just right.  Service is excellent. Timing of food coming out is about right. Per recommendation, 3-4 tapas per person to share. I would say 3 is perfect per person. Server might push to order double but best just one order and try more selection.   Drinks were amazing.  Ask server for off the menu drinks like Pasion fruit martini with spice.  We enjoyed our mai tai and lychee martini. They have a good selection of Japanese whiskey.   My son enjoyed his nigiri selection of salmon, fatty tuna, and yellowtail.  We loved the yellowtail sashimi.  The waygu beef sushi with truffle is spot on.   We settled with the 14 oz ribeye- cooked perfectly with dipping sauce. I would say if you like pork belly- you must get the Kurabuto pork belly. Scallop skewer was excellent.    Every dish we got was really good. No regrets. Dimsum/potsticker, Alaskan king crab, spinach salad with sesame dressing, shiitake mushrooms, and corn.    Make room for dessert- each one that we got was delicious and perfect ending to the meal.   I would definitely come back and recommend this place to our friends either for a meal, dessert or drinks only.

JpDospgMbEuLxdnXO-ipEA.text: Came here on a Monday night around 7:30, no crowds, food delivery was very quick, but still timed well.   The restaurant is very modern and chic. The back is open glass to the strip, which was very cool. There are three kitchens at this restaurant-- sushi bar, yakatori, and traditional kitchen.   We ordered: -shishito peppers -yellowtail sashimi  -pork belly skewers (a MUST)  -prawn dumplings  -Chilean seabass -wagyu skirt steak  -street corn   Overall the food was delicious, very flavorful, and the sauces were very rich, but not overpowering. I would come back again, although I was not blown away. The portions are very small, so be sure to order 2-4 dishes per person.   The service was excellent, we never had an empty glass, and our plates were cleared the instant we were finished.

KdC754gwGCMV1I14FCm95g.text: My husband and I have been coming to Zuma since it opened, about 2 years ago. We come here for birthday, celebratory and business dinners, anywhere from 1 to 3 dinners per month. We usually order many items to share, as the portions are small, like tapas. The prices have have increased over the years, which is to be expected. What I didn't expect was the portion size, particularly the black cod, to decrease so much. At first I thought we were just getting unlucky pieces, but then during the last few dinners, several different people mentioned this. My husband said he usually orders the same items for his business dinners, but last time he had to order extra for the same group of people.  I came here with my in-laws for the first time this past Thursday, and I was just embarrassed. We weren't hungry, but I wanted them to try a few of the popular items. The black cod serving was so small! I wish I took a picture, but I think I was just in shock. It must also have been too salty for them because they wanted white rice. The seafood and vegetable tempura was good but also smaller than previously ordered. The dumplings and mushroom rice hot pot were okay. The skimping of the food is starting to give the restaurant a cheap feel. The sushi on the other hand was fantastic. The dynamite spider roll, toro and hamachi with fresh wasabi were perfect. The server was nice, although we felt like we were always looking for her. Other staff was around to accommodate us. I think we're starting to feel a little bit more disappointed every time we eat here.
